content: all your new work is neither Testament nor Odyssey? the opposite, I call them to the witness-stand, knowing they’ll always be bigger than the tapestry I’m trying to sew them into (a crossing) pp. 313-14 diminish the infinite, diminish ad infinitum: that’s the temptation/dream since ever: but you’re doing it w/out being sure of textile to come, as if caught in sails (voiles) & pushed toward unknown, at the point of this extremity, as if someone were awaiting new Messiah, i.e. a “happy event”—nicknamed the verdict > yes, but a verdict w/out truth, w/ a due date no longer caught up in revealing a truth, the fold or unfolding of a veil—writing from distant place of as if

linkedContent: St. Paul thought he knew the literality of the letter, thought he was distinguishing for the first time, & he prided himself on it, wrongly, the circumcision of the heart (breath, spirit) from that of the flesh (body, “acc. the letter”)

content: St. Paul: Man is the glory of God / Woman is the glory of man
linkedContent: St. Paul: Man is the glory of God / Woman is the glory of man

content: St. Paul wanted to veil heads of women & unveil those of men, he denounced children of Israel for not knowing how to lift the veil (over face of God, covenant, on heart) > he wonders how service of breath/spirit/life (not death) wouldn’t be more luminous, unveiling
linkedContent: St. Paul wanted to veil heads of women & unveil those of men, he denounced children of Israel for not knowing how to lift the veil (over face of God, covenant, on heart) > he wonders how service of breath/spirit/life (not death) wouldn’t be more luminous, unveiling

content: “not in a hurry”: I am against those who prescribe the veil, against those who forbid it (same w/ circumcision) > people don’t realize any longer that the scholarly, secular, democratic belong to cultures of tallith & veil: contamination is everywhere
linkedContent: “not in a hurry”: I am against those who prescribe the veil, against those who forbid it (same w/ circumcision) > people don’t realize any longer that the scholarly, secular, democratic belong to cultures of tallith & veil: contamination is everywhere

content: “this very mild, this terrible Paul” > whose monstrous progeniture are our history/culture, he points to nature & tells us to judge for ourselves [re: woman wearing veils]
linkedContent: “this very mild, this terrible Paul” > whose monstrous progeniture are our history/culture, he points to nature & tells us to judge for ourselves [re: woman wearing veils]

content: this irreducible reality of an event (outside discourse but not text)—is so unlike you? > but, it’s the signature, a hem, on the edge, forever heterogenous, a tear, overlap, remaining caught in poetic stitches—thus the effects of anticipated iterability
linkedContent: this irreducible reality of an event (outside discourse but not text)—is so unlike you? > but, it’s the signature, a hem, on the edge, forever heterogenous, a tear, overlap, remaining caught in poetic stitches—thus the effects of anticipated iterability

content: [read Cixous’ Savoir] only in a French to come, only happen in delayed form—inheriting w/out inheriting, reinventing mother & father [baby daddy]
linkedContent: [read Cixous’ Savoir] only in a French to come, only happen in delayed form—inheriting w/out inheriting, reinventing mother & father [baby daddy]

content: (but Paul remains, and Freud)
linkedContent: (but Paul remains, and Freud)

content: [to read the corpus that has known, from operation of other, how to undo itself from veiling/unveiling] you have to write, sign in turn, countersign in writing, something else, in another language, w/out betraying injection/call of first seal
linkedContent: [to read the corpus that has known, from operation of other, how to undo itself from veiling/unveiling] you have to write, sign in turn, countersign in writing, something else, in another language, w/out betraying injection/call of first seal

content: it destines itself to those men & women who will know how to read, of course—knowing how to read (voilà, the circle) only on basis of gage given > reading finally what you have to read
linkedContent: it destines itself to those men & women who will know how to read, of course—knowing how to read (voilà, the circle) only on basis of gage given > reading finally what you have to read

content: can’t prove it happened, only swear that it did: perjury must remain possible (a duty that must be respected)
linkedContent: can’t prove it happened, only swear that it did: perjury must remain possible (a duty that must be respected)

content: know of no more perverse & unjust misprision: [that it will only be in a French to come that this corpus here can be read]
linkedContent: know of no more perverse & unjust misprision: [that it will only be in a French to come that this corpus here can be read]

content: signature (operation of poetic writing) must not be absolutely invulnerable: an “I” signs in the place of the wound (the other operates on us w/out knowing)—so virtual that it remains > bears bereaved memory of an unrefusable lesion > seems older than self: you may have forgotten it, but it carries on dictating all the blows of fate (as if we desired even the worst of them)
linkedContent: signature (operation of poetic writing) must not be absolutely invulnerable: an “I” signs in the place of the wound (the other operates on us w/out knowing)—so virtual that it remains > bears bereaved memory of an unrefusable lesion > seems older than self: you may have forgotten it, but it carries on dictating all the blows of fate (as if we desired even the worst of them)

content: in-self-out-of-self ipseity > putting-outside-self its being-in-self
linkedContent: in-self-out-of-self ipseity > putting-outside-self its being-in-self

content: the gage of my foretelling destines: calls to make come, beyond any truth of ontological revelation
linkedContent: the gage of my foretelling destines: calls to make come, beyond any truth of ontological revelation

content: I do not foresee the future thus promised, I foretell it
linkedContent: I do not foresee the future thus promised, I foretell it

content: theory (beyond theory) of fetishism at moment of verdict, w/ whole history engaged in it (Freud, Exodus, St. Paul, the en abyme of un ver à soie), thought of the event w/out revealed/unveiled truth, w/out phallogocentrism, w/out greco-judeo-paulino-islamo-freud-heidggeriano-lacanian [no christiano!] veil, w/out (un)veiling of phallus
linkedContent: theory (beyond theory) of fetishism at moment of verdict, w/ whole history engaged in it (Freud, Exodus, St. Paul, the en abyme of un ver à soie), thought of the event w/out revealed/unveiled truth, w/out phallogocentrism, w/out greco-judeo-paulino-islamo-freud-heidggeriano-lacanian [no christiano!] veil, w/out (un)veiling of phallus

content: culpable edging of phallus, edges of the cut, support the veil, hold it like a roof, canvas—this theoretical toilet of the phallus is the concept > phallus is the concept: can’t oppose it, nor a “sexual theory”: unless you do something different, the way you set the sail (Benjamin)
linkedContent: culpable edging of phallus, edges of the cut, support the veil, hold it like a roof, canvas—this theoretical toilet of the phallus is the concept > phallus is the concept: can’t oppose it, nor a “sexual theory”: unless you do something different, the way you set the sail (Benjamin)

content: gentleness, softness (childhood, tallith)
linkedContent: gentleness, softness (childhood, tallith)

content: [BEAUTIFUL PASSAGE, as if they all aren’t] could a “theory of fetishism” ever measure up to infinite tenderness of “my own tallith” (as if such phrase preceded ipseity, “I”)? stranger to all maudlin, effusion, pathos—to all “Passion” > yet, compassion w/out limit: absolute delay of verdict that is/was/will make itself arrive w/out luminous vision (glory) > belongs to the night, my white tallith, absolute night
linkedContent: [BEAUTIFUL PASSAGE, as if they all aren’t] could a “theory of fetishism” ever measure up to infinite tenderness of “my own tallith” (as if such phrase preceded ipseity, “I”)? stranger to all maudlin, effusion, pathos—to all “Passion” > yet, compassion w/out limit: absolute delay of verdict that is/was/will make itself arrive w/out luminous vision (glory) > belongs to the night, my white tallith, absolute night

content: tallith not incommensurable w/ fetish, but a generalized not restricted fetishism (Glas); theory of fetish no longer merely a theory at moment of verdict

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: tallith not incommensurable w/ fetish, but a generalized not restricted fetishism (Glas); theory of fetish no longer merely a theory at moment of verdict

content: tallith is proper to man (not woman), like circumcision
linkedContent: tallith is proper to man (not woman), like circumcision

content: what luck, this verdict, feared chance, “enjoyment” here nicknamed resurrection, there will be for me worse than death > price to pay for extraordinarily ordinary life toward which I would like to turn w/out conversion > such enjoyment worth more than life itself [?]
linkedContent: what luck, this verdict, feared chance, “enjoyment” here nicknamed resurrection, there will be for me worse than death > price to pay for extraordinarily ordinary life toward which I would like to turn w/out conversion > such enjoyment worth more than life itself [?]

content: Derrida dreams of interruption of dream, a resurrection, at the ends of the verdict, that’s not a miracle but reality of the real, ordinary reality rendered beyond fantasy, hallucination > a verdict that never stopped suspending its moratorium, stretching out its imminence
linkedContent: Derrida dreams of interruption of dream, a resurrection, at the ends of the verdict, that’s not a miracle but reality of the real, ordinary reality rendered beyond fantasy, hallucination > a verdict that never stopped suspending its moratorium, stretching out its imminence

content: silkworm secretes absolutely, a thing which would never be an object it would stand against
linkedContent: silkworm secretes absolutely, a thing which would never be an object it would stand against

content: Celan: “Aschenglorie (…) grub ich mich in dich und in dich” > [I in you—love itself] love made itself make love next to watching dreaming child [too old, forbidden to be old, still young]
linkedContent: Celan: “Aschenglorie (…) grub ich mich in dich und in dich” > [I in you—love itself] love made itself make love next to watching dreaming child [too old, forbidden to be old, still young]

content: milk become thread, this filament
linkedContent: milk become thread, this filament

content: philosophy of nature, for the child I still am, was naivety itself, but also time of infinite apprenticeship, culture made up acc. fiction, the autobiography of lure (Dichtung und Wahrheit), beginning to write a novel of sericulture
linkedContent: philosophy of nature, for the child I still am, was naivety itself, but also time of infinite apprenticeship, culture made up acc. fiction, the autobiography of lure (Dichtung und Wahrheit), beginning to write a novel of sericulture

content: “fainting to the bottom of oneself” > “burying oneself gloriously in the shadow at the bottom of the other” > “its work and its being toward death”
linkedContent: “fainting to the bottom of oneself” > “burying oneself gloriously in the shadow at the bottom of the other” > “its work and its being toward death”

content: absolute knowledge not man’s thing but that of sericulture [?] > silkworm comes back to itself in its odyssey, wraps itself in its own shroud, kind of absolute knowledge: beyond any coupling, any sexual difference or rather duality of the sexes > [Derrida’s bestiary starting up]
linkedContent: absolute knowledge not man’s thing but that of sericulture [?] > silkworm comes back to itself in its odyssey, wraps itself in its own shroud, kind of absolute knowledge: beyond any coupling, any sexual difference or rather duality of the sexes > [Derrida’s bestiary starting up]

content: silkworm’s sex impossible to discern, the spitting outside oneself, secretion, of what will never leave it: female ejaculate, milk become thread, fantasy of penis (neither veil, nor web)
linkedContent: silkworm’s sex impossible to discern, the spitting outside oneself, secretion, of what will never leave it: female ejaculate, milk become thread, fantasy of penis (neither veil, nor web)

content: Derrida’s call, grain of a telephone ring: véraison (vary, change color, moment of ripening)—the moment the unforeseeable reappropriation of the silkworm took place > the surprise I had to expect never makes a mistake, took place only once, demands all time given to become what it was: the verdict, what a note, what news > as if nothing evil ever happened again, or only happen w/ death: “too late” > Derrida will never tell this tale, he promised
linkedContent: Derrida’s call, grain of a telephone ring: véraison (vary, change color, moment of ripening)—the moment the unforeseeable reappropriation of the silkworm took place > the surprise I had to expect never makes a mistake, took place only once, demands all time given to become what it was: the verdict, what a note, what news > as if nothing evil ever happened again, or only happen w/ death: “too late” > Derrida will never tell this tale, he promised

content: all the v’s: ver, vert, vers, verre, vérité
